path: UNISA/98906 - BSc Science in Computing/INF3707 - Database Design and Implementation/Unsorted/INF 3707/Exams/2017-June-Solutions.pdf
text: /* MAY-JUNE-2017 SECTION A QUESTION 1 1.1 C p499 1.2 C p214 1.3 C p162 1.4 A p296 1.5 A count (*) counts all the records in the table; 1.6 D 1.7 C p348 1.8 A 1.9 B p508 1.10 B 1.11 D 1.12 D p230 1.13 B 1.14 C 1.15 D 1.16 B 1.17 D 1.18 B 1.19 C DDL: CREATE,ALTER,DROP,RENAME 1.20 D */ --SECTION B-- --QUESTION 2.1-- DESC employees; --QUESTION 2.2-- SELECT e.employee_id "Emp#",e.last_name "Employee", e.job_id "Job", e.hire_date "Hire Date" FROM employees e, jobs j WHERE e.job_id = j.job_id; --QUESTION 2.3-- SELECT last_name,j.job_title,salary FROM employees, jobs j WHERE j.job_title IN ('Sales Representative','Stock Clerk') AND salary NOT IN (2500,3500,7000); --QUESTION 2.4-- SELECT DISTINCT job_id FROM jobs, departments d WHERE d.department_id IN (10,20); --QUESTION 3.1-- SELECT last_name, TO_CHAR(CURRENT_DATE - hire_date, '09,999') AS MONTHS_WORKED FROM employees ORDER BY months_worked; --QUESTION 3.2-- SELECT last_name,COMMISSION_PCT, DECODE (COMMISSION_PCT,null,'No',COMMISSION_PCT,'YES')"Commision" From employees; --The syntax of the DECODE function is DECODE(V, L1, R1, L2, R2, ..., D) PAGE 385-- --QUESTION 3.3-- --QUESTION 3.4-- --QUESTION 3.5-- SELECT employee_id,last_name FROM employees WHERE last_name IN (SELECT last_name FROM employees WHERE last_name LIKE '%u%'); --QUESTION 4.1-- CREATE TABLE employees_3 (employee_id NUMBER(6) PRIMARY KEY, Ô¨Årst_name VARCHAR2(20), last_name VARCHAR2(25)); --QUESTION 4.2-- DELETE employees_3; --QUESTION 4.3-- CREATE SEQUENCE emp_seq_01 START WITH 2010 MAXVALUE 2999 INCREMENT BY 2; --QUESTION 4.4-- INSERT INTO employees_3 VALUES(emp_seq_01.NEXTVAL,'Steve','Maiden'); --QUESTION 5.1-- ALTER TABLE empdata MODIFY id NUMBER(6) PRIMARY KEY; --QUESTION 5.2-- SELECT object_name FROM user_objects WHERE object_type IN ('employees_3','empdata'); --QUESTION 5.3-- DROP TABLE employees_4; PURGE TABLE employees_4;
